dt: {bc}relating to, being, or appealing to affluent consumers

shortdef: relating to, being, or appealing to affluent consumers; also : of a superior quality

dt: {bc}to make (something) more appealing to affluent consumers {bc}to make (something) more {d_link|upscale|upscale:1}

dt.t: The council is renaming them the Fashion Awards, globalizing them, moving the hoopla around them to the Royal Albert Hall and otherwise {wi}upscaling{/wi} them.
{ldquo}Everybody's trying to {wi}upscale{/wi} men's colognes because the prestige brands have taken share from the mass brands,{rdquo} says cosmetics industry consultant Allan Mottus.
… even retained a handwriting teacher to {wi}upscale{/wi} her penmanship—no more tiny circles over her i's.

dt: {bc}to increase the size; scope, or scale of (something)

dt.t: A star is an {wi}upscaled{/wi} nuclear reactor, not a bonfire.
As a result, an {wi}upscaling{/wi} of the problem of underrepresentation to the national scale mobilizes scalar politics …

shortdef: to make (something) more appealing to affluent consumers : to make (something) more upscale; also : to improve the quality of (something)
to increase the size; scope, or scale of (something)

dt: {bc}to or toward the upper, more expensive end of a range of products or services

dt.t: He tried to move {wi}upscale{/wi}—toward higher-cost, higher-profit garments, which, in theory, would be less susceptible to price competition.
… chef Celestino Drago has taken Sicilian cuisine {wi}upscale{/wi} in his chic Santa Monica restaurant.

shortdef: to or toward the upper, more expensive end of a range of products or services

dt: {bc}to start to sell products for people with more money

shortdef: to start to sell products for people with more money
